page.title: 04WEST WITTERING CHURCH
page.content: West Wittering,the most South West point of Sussex,has grown up unusually North of its ancient church which basically dates from c. 1200,though the font dates from the earlier building on the site. In the Middle Ages the church contained a relic of St. Richard,the popular saint of Chichester,and some interesting graffiti survive in the South Chapel where this was located until it was destroyed at the Reformation.The most interesting feature of the Church is the Lily Crucifix,which is unique to England, and of which only a few examples remain.
